COMPLETE.CompleteWithManySegments: Clock advanced by {change} segments to {newValue}⁄{maxValue}—clock completed!
COMPLETE.CompleteWithTwoSegments: Clock advanced by {change} segments to {newValue}⁄{maxValue}—clock completed!

IN_A_BAD_SPOT.Description: When in a bad spot, you must make reactive moves such as <move>React Under Fire</move> and <move>Clash</move>. The outcome of a combat move will describe your current position.

GAIN.Alert: {name} is put in a bad spot

IN_A_BAD_SPOT.Label: In a bad spot

IN_CONTROL.Description: If you are in control, you can make proactive moves such as <move>Gain Ground</move> and <move>Strike</move>.
IN_CONTROL.Label: In control

CONNECTION.Description: A <term>connection</term> represents an important relationship with an NPC. Connections are not shipmates or companions. They are independent characters whose own lives occasionally intersect with your own. You might accompany the connection on a specific mission, but you’ll soon part ways as your duties and ambitions take you on separate paths.
CONNECTION.Title: Connections

BANES.Description: <term>Banes</term> are permanent. They forever impact your character through the momentum adjustment and—more importantly—the narrative impact of being maimed or corrupted.
BANES.Title: Banes

BURDENS.Description: <term>Burdens</term> are a result of life-changing experiences that leave you bound to quests. Clearing a burden can only be accomplished by resolving the quest.
BURDENS.Title: Burdens

CONDITIONS.Description: If you are wounded, shaken, or unprepared, you cannot increase the associated track until you make a move to clear the debility.
CONDITIONS.Title: Conditions

CORRUPTED.Description: <term>Corrupted</term> may be marked when you are at 0 spirit and fail to <move>Endure Stress</move>. Your experiences have left you emotionally scarred. You are at the threshold of losing yourself to darkness.
CORRUPTED.Label: Corrupted

DOOMED.Description: <term>Doomed</term> is marked when you <move>Face Death</move> and return from death’s door with a soul-bound quest.
DOOMED.Label: Doomed

ENCUMBERED.Description: <term>Encumbered</term> is marked as appropriate to the circumstances when you are carrying excessive or cumbersome weight. Encumbered is cleared when you lighten your load.
ENCUMBERED.Label: Encumbered

MAIMED.Description: <term>Maimed</term> may be marked when you are at 0 health and fail to <move>Endure Harm</move>. You have suffered a wound which causes you ongoing physical challenges, such as the loss of an eye or hand. Or, you bear horrific scars which serve as a constant reminder of your failures.
MAIMED.Label: Maimed

SHAKEN.Description: <term>Shaken</term> may be marked when you are at 0 spirit and fail to <move>Endure Stress</move>. You are despairing or distraught, and need comfort to recover. You cannot increase your spirit track until you <move>Sojourn</move> to clear this debility.
SHAKEN.Label: Shaken

TORMENTED.Description: <term>Tormented</term> is marked when you <move>Face Desolation</move> and undertake a quest to prevent a dire future.
TORMENTED.Label: Tormented

UNPREPARED.Description: <term>Unprepared</term> is marked when you are at 0 supply and are <move>Out of Supply</move>. You and your allies share the same supply value, and will mark unprepared together. You cannot increase your supply track until you <move>Sojourn</move> to clear this debility.
UNPREPARED.Label: Unprepared

WOUNDED.Description: <term>Wounded</term> may be marked when you are at 0 health and fail to <move>Endure Harm</move>. You are severely injured and need treatment to recover. You cannot increase your health track until you <move>Heal</move> or <move>Sojourn</move> to clear this debility
WOUNDED.Label: Wounded

FIRST_START.Intro: Welcome to Ironsworn! There are just a few choices to make before starting.

DELETE.Confirm: Are you sure? This cannot be undone.
DELETE.Label: Delete

BATTERED.Description: <term>Battered</term> may be marked when your vehicle is at 0 integrity and you fail to <move>Withstand Damage</move>. It’s barely holding together. Until you successfully <move>Repair</move>, you cannot raise the vehicle’s integrity.
BATTERED.Label: Battered

BURDENS.Description: <term>Burdens</term> leave you bound to new vows. Clearing a burden can only be accomplished by resolving the quest.
BURDENS.Title: Burdens

CURSED.Description: <term>Cursed</term> is marked when you <move>Face Death</move> and return with a soul-bound quest. This burden can only be cleared by completing the quest.
CURSED.Label: Cursed

DOOMED.Description: <term>Doomed</term> is marked when you <move>Face Death</move> and return from death’s door with a soul-bound quest.
DOOMED.Label: Doomed

INDEBTED.Description: <term>Indebted</term> is marked when you <move>Overcome Destruction</move>. To replace what was lost and repay the debt, you will take on a duty-bound quest.
INDEBTED.Label: Indebted

LASTING_EFFECTS.Description: Lasting effects are permanent. They forever impact your character through the momentum adjustment and—more importantly—the narrative impact.
LASTING_EFFECTS.Title: Lasting effects

MISFORTUNES.Description: If you are wounded, shaken, or unprepared, you cannot increase the associated condition meter until you make a <term>recover move</term> to clear the impact.
MISFORTUNES.Title: Misfortunes

PERMANENTLY_HARMED.Description: <term>Permanently harmed</term> may be marked when you are at 0 health and fail to <move>Endure Harm</move>. You have suffered a wound that you must reckon with, such as the loss of an eye or hand. Or you bear physical scars that are a constant reminder of a harrowing incident.
PERMANENTLY_HARMED.Label: Permanently harmed

SHAKEN.Description: <term>Shaken</term> may be marked when you are at 0 spirit and fail to <move>Endure Stress</move>. You are despairing or distraught. You cannot increase your spirit meter until you <move>Hearten</move> to clear this impact.
SHAKEN.Label: Shaken

TORMENTED.Description: <term>Tormented</term> is marked when you <move>Face Desolation</move>, gain visions of a distressing future, and undertake a quest to prevent that dire fate.
TORMENTED.Label: Tormented

TRAUMATIZED.Description: <term>Traumatized</term> may be marked when you are at 0 spirit and fail to <move>Endure Stress</move>. Your experiences have left you emotionally or mentally scarred.
TRAUMATIZED.Label: Traumatized

UNPREPARED.Description: <term>Unprepared</term> is marked when you <move>Sacrifice Resources</move> and are reduced to 0 supply. You are not properly equipped for the dangers of the Forge. Because you and your allies share the same supply value, you mark unprepared together. You cannot increase your supply meter until you <move>Resupply</move> to clear this impact.
UNPREPARED.Label: Unprepared

VEHICLE_TROUBLES.Description:
Vehicle troubles are only a factor when you are piloting or aboard that vehicle. Otherwise, they do not count as an impact and do not affect your maximum momentum and momentum reset.

If playing with allies, a vehicle trouble affects anyone on the vehicle, regardless of who owns or manages the asset.
VEHICLE_TROUBLES.Title: Vehicle troubles

WOUNDED.Description: <term>Wounded</term> may be marked when you are at 0 health and fail to <move>Endure Harm</move>. You are severely injured.  You cannot increase your health meter until you <move>Heal</move> to clear this impact.
WOUNDED.Label: Wounded

DISCOVERIES.Description: Explore the Forge and unlock its mysteries.
DISCOVERIES.Label: Discoveries

QUESTS.Description: Swear vows and do what you must to see them fulfilled.
QUESTS.Label: Quests

LOCATION.RequiresType: This oracle requires a location type to be selected.

ACTION_DIE_CANCEL.Description: Your action die was cancelled because the number on the action die matched your negative momentum value. You can’t take a bonus from an asset ability triggered by that die. If an asset forces a penalty for a specific action die value, that outcome still applies.

BURN.Description: <term>Burning momentum</term> is a powerful option to deliver a decisive result or avoid dire failure. When you have positive momentum, after you make an action roll, you may replace your action score with your current momentum value to improve your result.
BURN.Label: Burn

MAXIMUM.Description: Your max momentum is reduced by 1 for each marked impact. For example, one impact will drop your max momentum to +9. Three impacts will reduce it to +7.
MAXIMUM.Label: Max

RESET.Description: If you have one marked impact, your momentum reset is +1 (instead of +2). If you have more than one marked impact, your momentum reset is 0 (instead of +2).
RESET.Label: Reset

SEARCH.Description: Start typing to filter moves by their names and categories.
Start typing to filter oracles by their names and categories.

PROGRESS.RollAndCompare: Roll the challenge dice and compare to your progress ({number})

STAR.Description: When active, this item will also show up on the 'Legacies' tab.

PROGRESS.Title: Progress

REGION.Description: The Forge is divided broadly into four regions. The choices you made when you selected your campaign truths will influence how you envision the regions and the people who live there. But the relative differences between the regions will remain the same: The Terminus is where the bulk of your people live, the Outlands is an expanding frontier, and the Expanse is what lies beyond.

EXPANSE.Description: Only a few bold pioneers have delved these far-flung reaches. If you’re ready to face the dangers of lonely exploration within uncharted space, start here.
EXPANSE.Label: Expanse
EXPANSE.Lore: A few bold pioneers have delved the far-flung reaches of the Forge. Isolated settlements have been built among these distant domains, but they are usually lost and disconnected from the settled regions.

OUTLANDS.Description: This region represents an area of recent expansion. Settlements here are scattered, and navigational paths are often uncharted and perilous. If you envision yourself as a spacer on a wild frontier, start here.
OUTLANDS.Label: Outlands
OUTLANDS.Lore: In the last few decades, your people have pushed deeper into the galaxy, searching for habitable planets, resources, and opportunities. Settlements within the Outlands are scattered, and navigation paths are often uncharted.

TERMINUS.Description: Settlements are relatively common here, and spaceborne routes between communities are usually well-charted. If you want to focus on interacting with other people and communities, start here.
TERMINUS.Label: Terminus
TERMINUS.Lore: Your people landed in this region following their exodus from their home galaxy. Settlements are common here. Factions compete for resources, and spaceborne caravans follow charted paths among the stars. But the Forge is a vast galaxy; even here, there are still unknown and isolated domains.

REGION.Title: Select region

VOID.Description: In the reaches beyond the Forge, isolated stars are separated by vast gulfs of nothing. Travel and settling here is impractical if not impossible. Don’t start your campaign here.
VOID.Label: Void
VOID.Lore: Beyond the Forge, there are only a few isolated stars and vast gulfs of nothing. Travel beyond the periphery of the Forge is difficult or impossible.

HEALTH.Description: <term>Health</term> represents your physical condition and stamina.
HEALTH.Label: Health

MOMENTUM.Description: Your <term>momentum meter</term> ranges from -6 to +10 and represents your inertia, luck, and confidence. Move results and asset abilities may prompt you to increase or decrease momentum.
MOMENTUM.Label: Momentum

SPIRIT.Description: <term>Spirit</term> is your morale and mental state.
SPIRIT.Label: Spirit

DESCRIPTION.Classic: <term>Supply</term> is an abstract representation of your preparedness, including ammo, food, water, and general upkeep.
DESCRIPTION.Starforged: <term>Supply</term> is an abstract representation of your overall preparedness, including food, water, fuel, weapons, ammo, equipment, cargo, money, and general upkeep.

MISS.Description: You failed or face a dramatic turn of events.
MISS.Label: Miss

MATCH.Description: The match represents a heightened negative outcome, a complication, or new danger.
MATCH.Label: Miss with a match

STRONG_HIT.Description: You succeeded and are in control.
STRONG_HIT.Label: Strong hit

MATCH.Description: The match represents an interesting twist or new opportunity.
MATCH.Label: Strong hit with a match

WEAK_HIT.Description: You succeed, but with a cost or lesser effect.
WEAK_HIT.Label: Weak hit

ConfigurationDialog.Hint: Choose between Ironsworn and Starforged UI elements.
ConfigurationDialog.Label: Ironsworn/Starforged configuration dialog
ConfigurationDialog.Name: Configuration dialog

EvenMatchesOnly.Hint: Resolve the impact of a match only when the challenge dice come up as an even number (2, 4, 6, 8, or 10).
EvenMatchesOnly.Name: Even matches only

LogChanges.Hint: If on, changes to character stats will be logged to the chat.
LogChanges.Name: Log character updates

PromptTruths.Hint: Open the above dialog on startup.
PromptTruths.Name: Ironsworn/Starforged Dialog on Start

SharedSupply.Hint: If on, changing any character/shared supply meter changes all other actors' supply meters as well.
SharedSupply.Name: Shared supply meter

Theme.Hint: Select the visual look for this game. Requires a reload.
Theme.Name: Visual theme

Tools.Hint: Which set of moves and oracles will appear when opening a character sheet.
Tools.Name: Character tools

EDGE.Description: Quickness, agility, and prowess when fighting at a distance.
EDGE.Label: Edge

HEART.Description: Courage, willpower, empathy, sociability, and loyalty.
HEART.Label: Heart

IRON.Description: Physical strength, endurance, aggressiveness, and prowess when fighting at close quarters.
IRON.Label: Iron

VOW.Recommit: Recommit to the quest (after rolling a miss on Fulfill Your Vow)

RecommitDescription.Ironsworn: Clear all but one filled progress, and raise the quest’s rank by one (if not already epic).
RecommitDescription.Starforged: Roll both challenge dice, take the lowest value, and clear that number of progress boxes. Then, raise the vow’s rank by one (if not already epic).

VOW.Title: Vows
